Run the machine learning pipeline

run_ml.Rd

Run the machine learning pipeline

run_ml(
  dataset,
  method,
  outcome_colname = NULL,
  outcome_value = NULL,
  hyperparameters = NULL,
  find_feature_importance = FALSE,
  kfold = 5,
  cv_times = 100,
  training_frac = 0.8,
  group = NULL,
  corr_thresh = 1,
  seed = NA,
  ncores = NA
)

Arguments

dataset

dataframe with an outcome variable and other columns as features
method

ML method ("regLogistic", "rf", "rpart2", "svmRadial", "xgbTree")
outcome_colname

column name as a string of the outcome variable
outcome_value

outcome value of interest as a string
hyperparameters

dataframe of hyperparameters (default: NULL). if NULL given, they will be chosen automatically.
find_feature_importance

run permutation imporance (default: FALSE)
kfold

fold number for k-fold cross-validation (default: 5)
cv_times

Number of partitions to create
training_frac

fraction size of data for training (default: 0.8)
group

vector of groups to keep together when splitting the data into train and test sets, and for cross-validation; length matches the number of rows in the dataset (default: no groups)
corr_thresh

for feature importance, group correlations above or equal to corr_thresh (default: 1)
seed

random seed (default: NA)
ncores

number of cores for parallel processing (default: NA). parallel and doParallel packages are needed for ncores > 1

Value

named list with results

Author

Begüm Topçuoğlu, topcuoglu.begum@gmail.com

Zena Lapp, zenalapp@umich.edu

Kelly Sovacool, sovacool@umich.edu

Examples

if (FALSE) {
run_ml(otu_large, "regLogistic")
run_ml(otu_mini, "regLogistic",
  kfold = 2,
  find_feature_importance = TRUE
)
}
